Polina Shklyanoy and Patrick Schultz are to be married this afternoon by Rabbi David Sandmel at KAM Isaiah Israel Congregation in Chicago.

The bride, 31, is an associate at Boundas, Skarzynski, Walsh & Black, a law firm in New York. She graduated from Northwestern, where she also received a master's degree in journalism; she received a law degree from George Washington University.

She is a daughter of Bena Shklyanoy of Skokie, Ill., and the late Mikhail Shklyanoy. Her mother is a project manager for information technology at HSBC, the London bank, in Mount Prospect, Ill. Her father was a structural engineer in Skokie.

The bridegroom, 28,is a doctoral student, and also has a master's degree, in geosciences at Princeton, where he is studying the effects of climate change on ocean biology. He graduated from the University of Stuttgart in Germany; he received a master's degree in environmental engineering from Michigan Technological University in Houghton, Mich.

He is the son of Christl and Horst Schultz of Bad Liebenzell, Germany. His mother taught English, German and art at the secondary school in Bad Wildbad, Germany, until 1999, and now teaches students in her home. His father, who is retired, was a manager for planning and engineering of assembly plants at DaimlerChrysler in Sindelfingen, Germany.
